lines.content: > We are excited to show you how to use Wagwan
> Wagwan is a desktop app that helps you keep track of your tasks, so you'll never have to!
1. Ensure you have Java 11 or above installed in your Computer.
3. Copy Wagwan.jar into an empty folder you want to use as the home folder for Wagwan.
4. Open a command window in that folder.
5. Run the command java -jar Wagwan.jar (i.e., run the command in the same folder as the jar file)
6. The GUI similar to the image below should appear in a few seconds.
7. Type the command in the command box and press Enter to execute it. Refer to the Features below for details of each command.
You can use Wagwan to help you store your to-dos, upcoming events, and also deadlines for your tasks !
### 2. Set dates for your events and tasks
You can add a date to your event and deeadlines for easy tracking !
You can quickly search for tasks using keywords and Wagwan will show you all tasks that matches the given keyword !
### `todo` - Adds a todo to the stored tasks
Adds a todo to the stored tasks, initialised as undone.
Adds the todo to the stored tasks.
Here are the tasks in your list:
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 1 tasks in the list.
### `deadline` - Adds a deadline to the stored tasks.
Adds a deadline to the stored tasks, initialised as undone.
Deadline must be of the form yyyy-mm-dd
Adds the deadline to the stored tasks.
Here are the tasks in your list:
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
### `event` - Adds an event to the stored tasks.
Adds an event to the stored tasks, initialised as undone. Date or time can be of any format
Adds the deadline to the stored tasks.
Here are the tasks in your list:
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 3 tasks in the list.
Lists out all stored tasks which are indexed, and you can see the task type (todo/event/deadline) as well as it's status (done/undone).
A list of all the stored tasks
Here are the tasks in your list:
Marks a task by index as completed and updates the status with "X"
Marks the task as done, reflected with "X"
ayo im watching you man ! keep going brotha! I've marked this task as done:
### `unmark` - Marks a task as not completed
Marks a task by index as not completed and removes the "X" status
Marks the task as undone, "X" status is removed
cmon man you gotta do better! I've marked this task as undone:
### `delete` - Deletes a task from the stored tasks.
Deletes a task by index. Index must be a number and in the range of the number of tasks.
Deletes the task from the stored tasks.
you have 2 tasks in the list.
### `find` - Searches for a task from the stored tasks.
Searches a task with description that matches given keyword.
Returns a list of all tasks with the matching keyword
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
Updates the description of the task with the given index. Does not change the index of the task in the stored task list.
Updates the task of given index with the new description.
yessir, I have updated task 2 with the new description: Mom's Birthday
Exits program and saves all changes made to the tasks.
Exits program, saves changes made to tasks.

> We are excited to show you how to use Wagwan
> Wagwan is a desktop app that helps you keep track of your tasks, so you'll never have to!
1. Ensure you have Java 11 or above installed in your Computer.
3. Copy Wagwan.jar into an empty folder you want to use as the home folder for Wagwan.
4. Open a command window in that folder.
5. Run the command java -jar Wagwan.jar (i.e., run the command in the same folder as the jar file)
6. The GUI similar to the image below should appear in a few seconds.
7. Type the command in the command box and press Enter to execute it. Refer to the Features below for details of each command.
You can use Wagwan to help you store your to-dos, upcoming events, and also deadlines for your tasks !
### 2. Set dates for your events and tasks
You can add a date to your event and deeadlines for easy tracking !
You can quickly search for tasks using keywords and Wagwan will show you all tasks that matches the given keyword !

* A launcher class to workaround classpath issues.

* Wagwan helps keep track of user's tasks.
* Command is an abstract class that serves as a blueprint for all user commands parsed by Parser Class.
* The exit boolean decides if the command exits the program.
* Executes the given command and prints out Duke's response.
* @param tasks the TaskList that encapsulates an ArrayList of Task objects.
* @param ui the user interface that prints out Duke's response.
* @param storage the storage that saves changes made to the TaskList.
* @throws WagwanException if user input is invalid or insufficient.
public abstract String execute(TaskList tasks, WagwanUi ui, Storage storage) throws WagwanException;
* Checks if the command exits the program
* @return true if the command exits the program, false otherwise
* Command that adds a Deadline to the TaskList when executed.
public String execute(TaskList tasks, WagwanUi ui, Storage storage) throws WagwanException {
return ui.sendMessage(" Got it. I've added this task:\n" + "   " + newDeadline.toString()
+ "\n Now you have " + tasks.getTaskListSize() + " tasks in the list.");
return "this is a deadline command : deadline " + userAction;

* Deadline is a Task with a description and a date.
* @param deadline the date of the deadline.
* @throws WagwanException if there is a date format error.
public Deadline(String description, String deadline) throws WagwanException {
* Event is a Task with a description and a date/time.
* @param event the date/time of the event.
* Parser deals with making sense of the user command by formatting user inputs
* such that Duke can handle them through the Command Class and Ui Class
* Checks if a given command requires a description field.
* @param command the command of user input.
* @return True if the command of the user input requires a description field.
* Parses the user input and splits the input into a user command and user action
* to be passed into a Command object to execute the respective commands.
* @param command the full user input as a String.
* @return a Command object to execute the user input if it is valid.
* @throws WagwanException if the user input is invalid or insufficient.
public static Command parse(String[] command) throws WagwanException {
* Storage deals with loading tasks from the file and saving tasks in the file
* @param filePath the filepath of the .txt file.
* Loads previously stored tasks from a .txt file when the program starts and formats the
* data to be stored in a TaskList object or creates a new .txt file if the file is not found.
* @return an ArrayList of Task objects that has been formatted by Duke after reading the .txt file.
* @throws WagwanException if the target file cannot be found and creates a new .txt file.
* @throws IOException if error occurs when Duke is reading data from the target file.
* Helper function that helps read tasks from .txt file and loads them into TaskList
* @param nextTask a String array containing details of next task to be added.
* @throws WagwanException if error occurs while adding task.
public void addTaskFromStorage(String[] nextTask) throws WagwanException {
* Saves the tasks to a .txt file when changes are made to the TaskList object.
* @throws WagwanException if Duke is unable to find the target file to write data to.
* @throws IOException if error occurs when Duke is writing data to the target file.
public void save() throws WagwanException, IOException {
* Helper function that helps write tasks from TaskList into .txt file.
* @param task the task to be saved to tasks.txt.
* @param fw the Filewrite to write tasks to tasks.txt.
* @throws IOException if error occurs while adding task.
public void saveTaskToStorage(Task task, FileWriter fw) throws IOException {
* Task is a parent class that serves as a blueprint for all tasks a user can add to the to-do list.
* The done boolean decides if a task has been completed.
* A getter method that checks if a task has been completed.
* @return "X" if task has been completed, " " otherwise
* A setter method that marks an uncompleted task as done.
* A setter method that marks a completed task as undone.
* A setter method to update the description of a task.
* Shows the task's completion status and task description.
* @return Formats task's completion status and task description.
* TaskList contains the task list e.g., it has operations to add/delete tasks in the list
* The ArrayList of Task objects stored in the TaskList instance.
* Getter method that returns the ArrayList of Task objects currently stored.
* @return an ArrayList of Task objects that are currently stored in this instance of TaskList.
* Getter method that returns the number of Task objects stored.
* @return the number of Task objects stored in this instance of TaskList.
* Adds a task to the ArrayList of Task objects.
* @param task the task to be added into the ArrayList of Task objects.
* @throws WagwanException if the task is not an instance of a To-do, Deadline or Event object.
public void addTask(Task task) throws WagwanException {

* Updates a task to the ArrayList of Task objects using the index.
* @param index the index of the task in TaskList to update its description.
* @param newDescription the new description of the task to be updated.
public String updateTask(int index, String newDescription) throws WagwanException {
assert task.description != initialDescription : "Error updating description, please try again!";
return " yessir, I have updated task " + index + " with the new description : " + newDescription;
* Builds a string based on the list of tasks contained in the ArrayList of Task objects
* Deletes the task in the specified index from TaskList.
* @param index the index of the task in TaskList to be deleted.
* @return a message to tell the user that the task has been deleted and how many tasks are left in the list.
return WagwanUi.sendMessage(" yessir, I have removed \n" + "   " + task.toString()
+ "\n you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");
* Marks the task in the specified index from TaskList as done.
* @param index the index of the task in TaskList to be marked as done.
* @return a message to tell the user that the task has been marked as done.
return WagwanUi.sendMessage(" ayo im watching you man ! keep going brotha! "
+ "I've marked this task as done:\n" + "   " + task.toString());
* Marks the task in the specified index from TaskList as undone.
* @param index the index of the task in TaskList to be marked as undone.
* @return a message to tell the user that the task has been marked as undone.
return WagwanUi.sendMessage(" cmon man you gotta do better! "
+ "I've marked this task as undone:\n" + "   " + task.toString());
* Builds a string based on the list of tasks contained in the ArrayList of Task objects

* @param keyword the keyword to search for tasks containing the keyword.
* @return the details of all tasks that matches the specified keyword
*      in chronological order of which the user added to the TaskList.
String findMessage = "Here are the matching tasks in your list:\n" + list;
* Builds a string based on the list of tasks contained in the ArrayList
* of Task objects to be displayed to the user using command "list".
* @return the details of all tasks previously added by the user which are indexed
*      in chronological order of which the user added to the TaskList.
String listMessage = "Here are the tasks in your list:\n" + list;

* prints the error occured without terminating the program so the user
* will be able to know what caused the error and how to rectify it.
* WagwanUi is the user interface of Wagwan to return responses according to user inputs
